roles.name: Geologist
roles.description: Conducts geological surveys and evaluations to locate mineral resources, analyzing samples and mapping ore deposits.

meta.typicalBackground: Geology or earth sciences degree, knowledge of exploration techniques, field sampling, mineralogy
keyTools: GIS, remote sensing data, rock core analysis, geophysical surveys
challenges: Inaccessible terrain, weather extremes, ensuring accurate reserve estimates

sampleUseCase.scenario: A geologist identifies a promising copper deposit using seismic data and rock sampling, justifying a drilling program that confirms large-scale reserves.

roles.name: Mine Supervisor
roles.description: Oversees daily site operations—drilling, blasting, hauling—ensuring safety compliance, productivity, and proper resource utilization.

meta.typicalBackground: Mining engineering or extensive operational experience, leadership, thorough safety knowledge
challenges: Strikes or labor issues, equipment breakdowns, variable ore grades, stringent safety regulations

sampleUseCase.scenario: The supervisor reorganizes blasting schedules in an open-pit mine to avoid heat wave hours, reducing safety risks and maintaining production targets.

roles.name: Drilling Operator
roles.description: Operates drilling rigs to extract core samples or blast holes, following precise patterns for efficient and safe mining.

meta.typicalBackground: Skilled manual experience, specialized drilling certifications, knowledge of rig operation/safety
challenges: Machine malfunctions, alignment accuracy, harsh environmental conditions in remote sites

sampleUseCase.scenario: A drilling operator uses GPS-guided rigs to create blast holes in a patterned grid, optimizing fragmentation and minimizing rock overbreak.

roles.name: Mineral Processing Engineer
roles.description: Designs and optimizes processes to separate valuable minerals from ore, overseeing crushing, grinding, flotation, or smelting steps.

meta.typicalBackground: Metallurgical or chemical engineering, knowledge of extraction processes, chemical safety
keyTools: Flotation cells, gravity separators, leaching circuits, process simulation software
challenges: Variable ore composition, chemical hazards, water usage, achieving high recovery rates

sampleUseCase.scenario: An engineer fine-tunes the reagent dosage in a gold flotation circuit, raising recovery rates by 5% and reducing reagent costs.

roles.name: Health & Safety Officer
roles.description: Implements occupational health and safety protocols, conducts inspections, and investigates incidents to ensure mine worker wellbeing.

meta.typicalBackground: Safety management or industrial hygiene background, knowledge of mining hazards and regulatory compliance
keyTools: Safety audits, hazard reporting systems, protective equipment guidelines
challenges: Dangerous working conditions (cave-ins, explosions), ensuring consistent safety culture, emergency response readiness

sampleUseCase.scenario: A safety officer introduces a real-time gas detection system in an underground mine, training staff on evacuation procedures, thereby preventing injuries from sudden methane build-up.
